website_summaries.verdict: If you need a CamelBak that can stand up to just about any situation, this is the one to get. It offers the perfect combination of durability and space, though just a bit lacking in comfort.
pros: Built for tough conditions, as it is constructed of an extremely durable corduroy material
Adjusts easily for a snug fit
Has just enough pockets for a few necessary items
cons: The shoulder straps aren't padded and are fairly narrow, which may get uncomfortable with extended wear or if jostled around a lot

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: The actual hydration system is aces. Easy to use and clean. Holds a lot of water. The actual pack is just okay and seems like an afterthought. -It's VERY compact which is a good thing and a bad thing depending on your perspective. -The molle attachment points don't feel very sturdy to me as they are just holes in fabric (instead of webbing) -No shoulder pads on the straps. Bought some separately. -Drink tube doesn't have enough retention points and flops around a lot. Bought some seperately.  -Barely enough storage to hold all my stuff for mountain biking. I should have just bought they hydration system. (Not sure if that's even possible) Thought the pack would be more useful.
customer_reviews.author: SlabOMeat

customer_reviews.title: Slightly smaller than expected, but still a great pack
customer_reviews.text: Loving everything about it except the pocket size and shoulder straps. I was hoping for a little more room in the pockets. Still, the pockets are adequate, the bladder and feed system are outstanding, and the construction is top notch. The straps could use a little more width or padding at the top. I have above average traps and the straps dig a little after extended wear. This is not a deterrent to use, however. After a week straight with this on my back, I still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Mangiameli Jr

customer_reviews.title: Quality Hydration Pack
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pack! I love the quarter turn wide mouth filler neck. I also love the on and off controls for water flow at the bite valve. The 2 little compartments for storage are just what I was looking for, with the ability to add a pouch with the laser cut MOLLE on the bottom one. It wears good, shoulder padding is very sufficient. I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: 3 liters allows you to drink what you want without having to "ration" like the one and two letter packs
customer_reviews.text: Thrilled with this Camelbak! The mil spec model is head & shoulders above the rest of the line. 3 liters allows you to drink what you want without having to "ration" like the one and two letter packs. Kept water cold for 6-1/2 hrs in the Florida sun...kept it cool for 9 hrs SUPing on a 30 mile paddle. The two compartments are big enough to be useful but not too big. Even carry an extra 20 oz bottle of frozen water with electrolytes under the sinch strap between the top and bottom compartments. Very comfortable and first rate quality. Will be purchasing a second one to attach to my board to expand my range soon.
customer_reviews.author: rghdc

customer_reviews.title: great pack, but less space than you'd think
customer_reviews.text: great pack, but less space than you'd think. with a full 3 Liter load in the pack, you'd be surprised to learn that the pockets in this large camelbak cannot hold much. Regardless it is a nice pack. one less star for the storage limitations and overpricing of the pack in general. Otherwise a great fit for many people.
customer_reviews.author: anonymously

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: The pictures of this backpack make you think it's huge, but it's actually just the right size. Easy to wear and comfortable, I use this mostly for mountain biking and trail riding. There are some handy spots to hide away some energy bars or tools as well, but nothing much else. The build quality seems tight and I love the multi-cam pattern. Water stays cold on long rides (I usually add a tray of ice cubes first) and holds more than enough for a thirty plus mile ride or more. I highly recommend the Antidote from Camelbak!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Bad taste and smell
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, HORRIBLE “bad plastic/BPA” taste and smell that renders it unusable. Although it isn’t on the mouth drinking apparatus, it surrounds it all the way around and you can’t help but hit it or taste it.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Great for carrying water not to confident about the storage pockets.

Has two small storage pocket but you can add additional storage with the webbing it has. Make sure zippers are on either side and buckle is clipped otherwise branches will open it.

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for short to day hiking

If any longer would need more storage, but functioned flawlessly for its design.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for bonnaroo 2016 and it’s holding up great. I like it because it’s small but holds a good amount of water. I remember back when I was thinking about buying this camelback, I was worried about the straps not having padding. It’s never irritated my skin and I’ve worn it all day without a shirt on. The part that touches your back does get really wet from condensation but I think that would happen with most..

customer_reviews.title: Been in search of that perfect pack for hiking and hunting for years
customer_reviews.text: Kickass day pack. Been in search of that perfect pack for hiking and hunting for years. For me this is it. Enough storage to hold essentials and plenty of water for a day in the woods. Surprisingly comfortable and highly adjustable as well. Im 5'10 155lbs and i can wear it with my thickest jacket or over just a t shirt. temps range from 100°F+ to -40°F where i live so adjustability in a pack is important. Highly recommend!

product_meta.title: Camelbak Ambush Mil Spec Antidote Hydration Backpack
product_meta.description: Water is life. You need to have a hydration system of some type for range training, emergencies, travel or recreation. Camelbak has stayed at the forefront of hydration systems and is the one many other companies copy. Their packs are easy to use, clean out and are comfortable to wear all day on the range, biking or hiking. I keep one non-tactical-looking example stuffed with gear for covert emergency use. I have several others set up for various uses. Select at least one that fits your needs. Reservoir features: more than just a reservoir, the MIL spec antidote reservoir redefines the ultimate delivery system for an Operator's water supply and provides maximum adaptability for changing missions or combat environments. Includes our quick link exit Port and ql hydrolock Bite valve adapter: tube clicks off for faster refilling with auto shut-off; new fill Port: industry's largest opening with air-light 1/4 turn open/close for quick, secure seal that can't be over-tightened; lighter weight lower profile design. Additional features: external fill access-allows for a quick Refill without removing pack, Side-Release shoulder straps for rapid removal, multiple drink tube exit ports-for routing drink tube over the shoulder or under an arm, noiseless zipper pulls, top and bottom external zip pockets hold your essentials, lightweight, durable 500D corduroy fabric.
feature_bullets: Dimensions: 16 in x 10 in x 6 in (41 cm x 25 cm x 15 cm)

Fabric: 500D Ripstop Cordura fabric front panel, gusset and shoulder harness front side > 420D high density nylon on shoulder harness and back panel > 5 mm closed cell PE foam on back panel and inside hydration compartment > Nylon webbing
